intro: My journey through education, work, volunteering, and extracurricular activities.

events.description: I assist with in-gallery learning experiences in the Hall of Human Life, Engineering Design Workshop, and Charles River Yawkey Gallery. I lead experiments for all ages.

I participate in the Girls Who Code Pathways Program to develop coding skills and connect with other young women in tech. I received certificates in Neural Networks and Machine Learning, Data Science, and Artificial Intelligence.
I help draft grant proposals, plan community events, and collaborate with team members to identify strategic growth opportunities.
I assist professors with data science research focusing on algorithms affecting youth on social media platforms, analyzing large datasets to understand their impact.
I contribute to ongoing research projects on local, state, and federal elections in support of non-partisan political coverage.

I collaborated on engineering challenges by working on hardware projects involving soldering and Raspberry Pi. I developed and optimized embedded systems in machine code and built prototypes using woodworking and advanced design techniques.

I am currently organizing a group to prepare a proposal for the American Society for Engineering Education (ASEE) conference in Charlotte, NC, June 21-24, 2026, to present student experiences in engineering project activities.

events.organization: The Academies by Harvard Student Agencies
events.description: I participated in mock consulting projects by analyzing cases, presenting team solutions, and building skills through hands-on practice and remote collaboration in financial consulting.
I tutor students in math concepts across grades K-9. I adjust to students' needs and write detailed session reports for families.

I demonstrate personal goal-setting and time management through volunteer service, personal development, physical fitness, and exploration. I was awarded the Congressional Award Gold Certificate in December 2025.

I research, write, and collaborate on articles focusing on town events and local news while meeting deadlines. I have published more than ten articles covering community events, school productions, and local initiatives.
I attend seminars and discussions on economic issues. I engage with professionals and peers and stay informed on policy impacts through expert-led sessions.
I participated in a coding celebration event through Kode With Klossy.
I received the Athena Award for completing thirty hours of coding and engineering work.

I am currently a sophomore with a 4.0 unweighted GPA and 5.0 weighted GPA. I am active in Girls Who Code, DECA, Key Club, Ceramics Club, Model U.N., and Quiz Bowl. I qualified for DECA State in Financial Team Decision Making in December 2024, placing top six out of thirty teams. I participate in the math team and art history club and take AP Computer Science Principles and AP Modern World History.
I reviewed, edited, and wrote policy articles that address social, political, and economic issues tailored for youth audiences for clarity and accessibility.
I qualified for the Massachusetts Computer Science Olympiad (MASCO) In-Person Finals for excellence in a series of Python coding problems.

I completed an intensive summer program focused on foundational computer science concepts for girls. I gained hands-on experience with programming, algorithms, and problem-solving while collaborating on projects and developing technical skills. I finished the program with a C++ project.
I participated in two squash programs that improved my game skills and taught teamwork and discipline through competitive play.
I learned about acting, stage production, and ensemble collaboration. I participated in the production of Grease, discovering the creative process of putting on a show.

I attended an environmental camp focused on nature, ecology, and conservation. I spent time outdoors learning about ways to help the planet and developed an appreciation for environmental stewardship.
I participated in a middle-school theater production of Descendants, enjoying the creative collaboration and energy of youth theater.

roles.description: I contribute to educational projects through digital volunteering.
I volunteer to support museum programs and engage visitors in science activities.
I transcribe historical documents to make them accessible for research and learning.
I participate in community service projects through Key Club.
I volunteer in community service projects organized by Boston Cares.
I assist in research projects by classifying data for scientific studies.
